file_content.text: The Empire can never thank you enough.
My lord, this is the happiest of days.
My lord, you have laid waste to our enemies.
Agent, I hope you have space in your trophy room for a medal.
Hunter, you've more than earned your keep.
Well, this is certainly a happy day for all of us, isn't it?
The whole resistance is in shambles. The people's spirits are broken. Balmorra is as good as ours.
Fear and intimidation are the Empire's greatest weapons.
They were easy to break.
The Sith are the Empire's greatest weapon.
I'll be taking my pay then.
About my reward.
Of course. I think you'll find it most generous.
I delight in breaking people's spirits.
It was my pleasure.
Your joy is infectious, my lord.
If you ever need a resistance movement dismantled again, I'm your agent.
It was a pleasure.
Your dutiful work will be remembered.
They were pushovers. They deserve to be conquered.
They were weak.
The Empire agrees.
It looks like there's still a lot of fighting going on.
How can you be so sure?
Oh that'll happen, that always does. The government-in-exile has lost its teeth. It's the Empire, or it's anarchy. And people like peace.
We cannot possibly thank you enough for your service. Decades, we've been trying to win this war, and you've done it in a fraction of the time. Thank you.
We'll win this war yet.
Lieutenant Davrill is in charge of phase one of Operation Breaking Point. He's in Sobrik.
Hunter. I hope you know what you're getting yourself into.
My lord. Welcome to Balmorra. I hope you like bombed-to-pieces mudholes.
Agent. Good to see the Empire's finest hitting up this bombed-out crater.
Welcome to Balmorra. Hope you're ready for a war.
Captain Rigel, Imperial Conquest Consolidation Corps. When the Empire invades, we're the ones who seal the deal.
Don't suppose you're aware of the situation here on Balmorra?
I've been briefed, but I could use more details.
Fill me in.
It's war, bloody and limitless.
It's my understanding there's some kind of battle.
A war, right?
Yeah, if you can call a pile of bodies a battle.
I'm sure you'll fill me in.
Get to the point.
The Empire invaded Balmorra in the last war, but we've been spinning our wheels in the mud ever since.
Resistance fighters think they can drive the Empire off Balmorra. We're here to prove them wrong.
How hard can it be to put down a few resistance?
Sounds easy.
It's not just a few resistance. They're well organized and well armed, but they can be broken.
How do you expect to succeed where the Imperial Army has failed?
What's your plan?
We are the army, too. Other soldiers just don't have the capability to handle our kind of specialized missions.
What does this have to do with me?
Where do I come in?
We want the best Sith, agents and guns-for-hire in the galaxy to put this war down once and for all.
The Balmorran government-in-exile, backed by Minister of Defense Vol Argen, is giving us fits, backing a strong faction of the resistance.
The Minister is safely off-planet, but if we break his allies here, we break him. We break him, we break the resistance.
Why doesn't Imperial Intelligence just have him assassinated?
So kill him.
I get your thinking. Cut off the head and kill the body--except resistance movements aren't organisms, exactly.
If we took out Argen, it'd be big, but as long as his power base stands, some other idealist is bound to step in.
What about the rest of the Balmorran government-in-exile?
It's just one guy?
Vol Argen is the only one with military experience, and he's the most vocal.
When we destroy his power base and wipe the floor with his whiskers, none of the others will have the backbone to oppose us.
That's why we need to take everything out. Do we have the privilege of your support?
Normally I wouldn't be bothered, but this project sounds intriguing.
I won't refuse.
You have our heartfelt appreciation, my lord.
If the Empire requires it of me.
I will do my duty.
Spoken like a true patriot.
I will hunt the Empire's enemies, and I will break them.
Sounds perfect.
We are most honored to have you, my lord.
I won't turn down good work.
A job's a job.
A fighter and a businessman. Have it your way.
I'll think about it.
My second-in-command, Lieutenant Davrill, is in Sobrik waiting to brief you on the operation's first mission, if you decide you're in.
He's got plans to blow the Balmorran resistance sky-high. I think you'll like them.
I have better things to do with my time.
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
I can't say I'm not disappointed, but I understand. I hope you reconsider. The Imperial war effort depends on it.
What do you need me to do?
Then let's get to work.
That's what I'm looking for. People who want to get things done.
My second-in-command, Lieutenant Davrill, is masterminding phase one of what we like to call "Operation Breaking Point." You'll find him in Sobrik.
He's got plans to blow the Balmorran resistance sky-high. I think you'll like them.
I'm sorry. Too much to do. Can't talk.
